alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Lee; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 3:46AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Hancock, Henderson, Warren, northwestern McDonough, southern Henry, central Des Moines, northeastern Van Buren and Lee Counties through 430 AM CDT... At 345 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Biggsville to near Danville to near Bentonsport/Vernon. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Fort Madison, Monmouth, Oquawka, Nauvoo, West Burlington, New London, La Harpe, Roseville, West Point, Dallas City, Danville, Donnellson, Montrose, Stronghurst, Kirkwood, Blandinsville, Salem, Prairie City and Middletown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Des Moines; Henry; Lee; Van Buren
